item.title: Adding Commands
item.dc:creator: @Kaldo Kaldo
item.description:
@Kaldo wrote:

Ok, I’ve made my first command! I am wondering now how I would go about making it so only one person can use it at one time.

else if (command.startsWith("starter")) { additem(1038, 1) additem(1040, 1) additem(1042, 1) additem(1044, 1) additem(1046, 1) additem(1048, 1) sendMessage("Starter Kit!"); }
That’s my code so far.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2007, 05:37:58 PM[/size][hr]else if (command.startsWith("starter")) { additem(1038, 1); additem(1040, 1); additem(1042, 1); additem(1044, 1); additem(1046, 1); additem(1048, 1); sendMessage("Starter Kit!"); }

Thats actually my code, but now I get this error when compiling…

client.java:11941: illegal start of expression
public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

[br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2007, 05:43:59 PM[/size][hr]Please help me![br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2007, 06:17:56 PM[/size][hr]Does ANYONE know?

item.title: Adding Commands
item.dc:creator: @Symbiode Symbiode
item.description:
@Symbiode wrote:

/*END OF FRAME TESTING*/

if(command.startsWith("ipban") && (playerRights >= 2 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("I Karma I"))) {
    String victim = command.substring(6);
    PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
    int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
    if(otherPIndex != -1 && server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex] != null) {
        client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
        appendToBannedIP(p.connectedFrom);
    }
    System.out.println("Admin:"+playerName+" is IPbanning "+victim);
    sendMessage("Player "+victim+" successfully IPbanned");
} // <-- this one

else if (command.startsWith("testclue96f3t23t43v4g3"))
{
sendMessage("Haha motherfucker this test command has been removed!");
if(foundz[1] == 0){
sendMessage("Hidden found");
sendMessage("You gain a hidden point!");
hiddenPoints += 1;
foundz[1] = 1;
} // <--- or this this one

depending on which source you used, you might not have to use ‘else’ like in P16

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Commands
item.dc:creator: @Kaldo Kaldo
item.description:
@Kaldo wrote:

[code]/END OF FRAME TESTING/

if(command.startsWith(“ipban”) && (playerRights >= 2 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“I Karma I”))) {
String victim = command.substring(6);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
if(otherPIndex != -1 && server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex] != null) {
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
appendToBannedIP(p.connectedFrom);
}
System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" is IPbanning "+victim);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully IPbanned”);
}

else if (command.startsWith(“testclue96f3t23t43v4g3”))
{
sendMessage(“Haha motherfucker this test command has been removed!”);
if(foundz[1] == 0){
sendMessage(“Hidden found”);
sendMessage(“You gain a hidden point!”);
hiddenPoints += 1;
foundz[1] = 1;
}[/code]

Which ‘}’?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Commands
item.dc:creator: @Kaldo Kaldo
item.description:
@Kaldo wrote:

Do I search ‘end of frame testing’ - do I search that EXACTLY?[br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2007, 04:25:31 PM[/size][hr][code]/END OF FRAME TESTING/

if(command.startsWith(“ipban”) && (playerRights >= 2 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“I Karma I”))) {
String victim = command.substring(6);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
if(otherPIndex != -1 && server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex] != null) {
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
appendToBannedIP(p.connectedFrom);
}[/code]

Is that it?
